The 'Strep-tag'Â® system is a method which allows the purification and detection
of proteins by affinity chromatography. The Strep-tag is a synthetic peptide
consisting of eight amino acids (Trp-Ser-His-Pro-Gln-Phe-Glu-Lys). This peptide
sequence exhibits intrinsic affinity towards Strep-Tactin, a specifically
engineered streptavidin and can be N- or C- terminally fused to recombinant
proteins. By exploiting the highly specific interaction, Strep-tagged proteins
can be isolated in one step from crude cell lysates. Because the Strep-tag
elutes under gentle, physiological conditions it is especially suited for
generation of functional proteins.
